Vocabularies.Definition: disappoint; fail to help 使失望；不帮助
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I am counting on you to support me; don't let me down.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. look closely or carefully 仔细看
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He peered at me over the top of his glasses.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. feeling anxious or uncertain 不安的，担心的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I am uneasy about this decision.

Vocabularies.Definition: destroy；become free of 消灭；除去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I have tried all sorts of medicines to get rid of this cold.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. matter; material 东西；原料 e.g.  What is this sticky stuff on the floor?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What is this sticky stuff on the floor?

Vocabularies.Definition: v. become or make completely wet (使)浸透
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Leave the dirty clothes to soak.
e.g.  The sigh was swinging in the wind.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. pull (sth. or sb.) along with effort and difficulty 拖，拉，拽
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The protesters were dragged away by the police.
e.g.  I have reached the extent of my patience.
e.g. He may be late or, worse still, he may not come at all.

Vocabularies.Definition: in bad/good physical condition 身体状况差(好)
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She's been working too hard and she's in pretty bad shape.
e.g.  Defeat after defeat filled us with despair.

Vocabularies.Definition: use part of a supply of 利用；动用
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A writer has to draw on his imagination and experience.
e.g.  A rescue team is trying to reach the trapped miners.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the best or most exciting or interesting part 最重要的事件；最精彩的部分 vt. give special attention to 强调，突出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Recorded highlights of today's big football game will be shown after the news.
